website_summaries.verdict: Treats scalp and hair to regrow hair using natural ingredients.
pros: 3.38-ounce bottle lasts a long time because only a few drops are needed
Relies on natural ingredients like neem oil to regrow hair
Sensitive skin formula works with all skin types
cons: Does not contain powerful medical ingredients to regrow hair

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product so much to fix my dry scalp (due to weather, exercise, and shampooing). I put it in a spray bottle and spray it around my hairline after I get out of the shower, and sometimes after exercise. I don't know what use it is in this bottle - you would end up wasting a bunch I think. It helps keep my scalp healthy and makes my hair softer and smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine

customer_reviews.title: Best scalp treatment I've tried
customer_reviews.text: I'd previously tried Aveda's Invati line, which I discarded as it irritated my scalp. THIS stuff is VERY nice, soothing and stimulating at once. It's a non-oil base so doesn't goop your hair up, smells gently pleasant and really feels like it's doing some good. Plus my hair seems thicker in the 3 weeks I've been using it. One minor thing: it would benefit from some kind of dropper to facilitate getting the lotion on to the scalp instead of the hair - I've taken to decanting some into a regular dropper bottle and using that so I can part my hair with the dropper and distribute the lotion more evenly. Other than that, EXCELLENT product.
customer_reviews.author: Genuine Redhead

customer_reviews.title: NICE natural product
customer_reviews.text: The product is great - works on my sensitive scalp and fairly dry hair very nicely. Also a lovely smell. However, I think this listing is incorrect as the size on the Hauschka website is 3.40 oz, not 30.4 oz (which would be HUGE!) The website price is $30 plus shipping, or free shipping over $40 per order, so you'd have to consider if this was a good value or not. But the product itself seems excellent, definitely superior to "competitor" items such as Aveda.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cliver
